info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued January 10 at 11:32AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...The Minnesota Pollution Control Agency has issued an Air Quality Alert for fine particle pollution. The Air Quality Index (AQI) is expected to reach the Red or Unhealthy category in the Moorhead area. Across the rest of the alert area the Air Quality Index (AQI) is expected to reach the Orange or Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups Category. * WHERE...northwest Minnesota. * WHEN...Through 6 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Some members of the general public may experience health effects. Sensitive groups, such as people with lung disease (including asthma), heart disease, and children and older adults, may experience health effects. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light winds combining with moisture from melting snow will trap fine particulate pollution near the surface in central and northwestern Minnesota. Air quality will improve Wednesday with the arrival of a cold front which will allow the fine particle pollution to disperse. For information on current air quality conditions in your area and to sign up for daily air quality forecasts and alert notifications by email, text message, phone, or the Minnesota Air mobile app, visit https://www.pca.state.mn.us/air/current-air-quality. You can find additional information about health and air quality at https://www.pca.state.mn.us/air/why-you-should-care-air-quality-and- health.
info.instruction: Sensitive groups, such as people with lung disease (including asthma), heart disease, and children and older adults, should avoid prolonged or heavy exertion. The general public should limit prolonged or heavy exertion.
